content.description: A Theatre, Chandler and Ross are there to watch the premiere of Kathy’s play.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, she is the star of the play. And she is my girlfriend! I get to have sex with the star of the play!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: People can hear you.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I know!!
(The play starts.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Wow! She looks great. Doesn’t she?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah.
(Onstage there’s a knock on the door and Kathy opens it. We don’t see what’s going on, only hear it.)

content.speaker: Kathy’s Co-Star
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Kathy
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: That is one good looking man!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Is it just me, or can you actually see his abs through his overcoat?!

content.speaker: Kathy’s Co-Star
content.text: Sooo, you’ve been doing this long?

content.speaker: Kathy
content.text: No, you’re my first. Put the money on the table.
(Ross and Chandler have stunned looks on their faces as Kathy and her co-star start making out.)

content.speaker: Kathy’s Co-Star
content.text: Oh, yeah! Ooh, that’s nice. (They start making out harder.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Dude!

content.speaker: Kathy’s Co-Star
content.text: Is that an expensive blouse?

content.speaker: Kathy
content.text: If you want it to be.
(Kathy’s co-star rips her blouse off and buttons go flying into the audience, and one hits Ross. Chandler’s mouth is on the floor.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Here’s your girlfriend’s button. (Holding the button.)

content.description: Chandler and Joey’s, erm, Monica and Rachel’s, Monica is still unpacking after the move, and Phoebe is their also.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, hey, Mon, do you still have your like old blouses and dresses from high school?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah, I think I have some around here somewhere. Why?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, it’s just that maternity clothes are so expensive.
(Rachel enters)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey, Rach! I made a pile of your stuff over on this side of the room. If you could just…(Rachel grunts and throws her purse at it)…throw your purses at it.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Bloomingdale’s eliminated my department. (Phoebe gasps)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh my God, are you out of a job?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No, but they stuck me in personal shopping. Which is just a huge step down!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Personal shopping? What is that? Like where you walk around with snooty rich people and tell them what to buy?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Uh-huh.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: That sounds great!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey! (Goes to the fridge.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Umm, excuse me, we switched apartments. You can’t eat are food anymore, that-that gravy train had ended.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: There’s gravy?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: If you have the big apartment you have to deal with people coming over all the time. That fridge has got to be stocked, okay, that’s your department now. (She takes back the turkey leg)
(Joey climbs up on the counter and starts looking at the top of the cabinets.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What are you doing?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I think I left a donut up here.

content.description: Central Perk, Ross and Chandler are entering after the play. Phoebe and Joey are already there.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ooh! How was Kathy’s play?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, Kathy gets half-naked and simulates sex with a real good lookin’ guy.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, it’s like someone literally wrote down my worst nightmare and then charged me $32 to see it!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: That’s a good idea for a business!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I’m totally screwed. Okay, they are gonna be hot and heavy on stage every night, and then they’re gonna go to their cast parties and he’s gonna try to undermine me. Y’know it’ll be like, “So where’s your boyfriend, what’s-his-name, Chester?” And she’ll go, “No-no-no, it’s Chandler.” And he’ll go, “Whatever. Ha-ha-ha-ha!”

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: That-that is a good trick.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: All right, look, look, what am I gonna do?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Chandler, look they’re actors. They’re there to do a job, just ‘cause they work together, doesn’t mean they’re gonna get together. I mean just ‘cause it happened with Susan Sarandon and Tim Robbins, it doesn’t mean it’s gonna happen with them.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh-oh, Alec Baldwin and Kim Basinger.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Tom Cruise and Nicole Kidman.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey, Mel Gibson and Clint Eastwood.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: They’re not a couple!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh-okay, I get the game now.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay look, look, let me ask you a question, when they were doing it on stage, was it like really hot?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh yeah!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well okay, so then you’re fine. The rule is when two actors are actually doing it off-stage all the sexual tension between them is gone. Okay? So as long as it’s hot onstage you got nothing to worry about. It’s when the heat goes away, that’s when you’re in trouble.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Really?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Look, you guys have been to every play I’ve ever been in, have I ever had chemistry on stage?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Noooo!!

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, erm, Chandler and Joey’s, the gang minus Monica and Rachel are eating breakfast. Ross and Chandler are sitting at the foosball table and eating.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: So uh, man, are you gonna go to the play with me tonight?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Y’know what, I don’t know how comfortable I am going to see how hot the sex is between some guy and your girlfriend.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, I know but…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh no-no-no, I’m there.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey Mon! Want some pancakes?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You made pancakes?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yep! Grab a plate.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay. (She does so and starts to walk towards Joey to receive her pancakes.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No-no, stay right there. (Monica stops and Joey flips her a pancake, which flies over her head and lands in the living room.) Gettin’ closer.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, okay, but don’t worry, because we also have cereals, muffins, waffles, and , jams, jellies, and marmalades. Which I’m fairly certain are the same thing.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Listen also we’re uh, we’re watching the game here Saturday night, if people want to come over.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh yeah!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, I was thinking about having people over for the game.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh yeah, who’s playing?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: The players.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Somebody seems to be missing being the hostess.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Please, it’s a relief is what it is, is what it is.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All right Pheebs, stick out your plate!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh. (Joey flips the pancake and Phoebe catches it and throws it on her plate.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Monica, I’m quitting! I just helped an 81 year old woman put on a thong and she didn’t even buy it! (Pause) I’m telling you I’m quitting! That’s it! I’m talking to my boss right now! (Pause) Yes I am! (Pause) Yes I am! Yes I am! Yes I am! Yes I am! Yes I am! Okay bye, call me when you get this message. (Hangs up as her boss, Mr. Waltham, walks in.) Oh! Mr. Waltham, I ah really need to talk to you.

content.speaker: Mr. Waltham
content.text: In a moment, please, I’m in the middle of a task. And you have a customer.
(It’s a really good-looking man, Joshua, that Rachel has an instant crush on. Well actually it’s Tate Donovan, so it’s not like she’s really testing her acting skills.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Joshua
content.text: Hi, I’m Joshua.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi, I’m Rachel Green. What can I do for you Joshua?

content.speaker: Joshua
content.text: Well, I need a whole new wardrobe. My wife, well my ex -wife…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, I’m so sorry.
(He walks over to look and some clothes and Rachel quickly turns around and adjusts her bra, trying to show off her assets.)

content.speaker: Joshua
content.text: Anyway, she burned all of my clothes. I got away with two things. This suit and what turned out to be a skirt.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, at least that’s a great suit.

content.speaker: Joshua
content.text: Yeah, but it wasn’t much fun dropping it off at the dry cleaners in the skirt. (Rachel laughs) So I need everything down to underwear, so if you’re willing, I’m all yours.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Mr. Waltham
content.text: Rachel, you needed to speak to me?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No-no, that wasn’t me! (To Joshua) Well, we should get started. Let me show you my underwear. (Joshua turns at that) The selection of underwear we carry.
(He walks out and Rachel stares at his butt as he leaves. He makes a wrong turn.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh-oh, sorry, it’s this way, it’s this way. (Motions to the correct way.)

content.speaker: Joshua
content.text: It’s this way? Sorry. (He walks past her and she again admires his butt.)

content.description: Kathy’s play, Ross and Chandler are waiting for her in the lobby after the play.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I’m right! Right? There was like no chemistry between them. Before they had heat, and now there’s no heat! Now you know what this means, Joey told us what this means!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: All right, let’s not jump to any conclusions. All right? There was some sexual chemistry between them.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Come on, it was like cousins having sex up there!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Here she comes. Don’t say a word, okay? Just be cool, don’t be…y’know you.

content.speaker: Kathy
content.text: Hey you guys!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Kathy
content.text: Hi! (Kisses Chandler) Thank you so much for coming again. Did you like it tonight?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, absolutely! (Chandler mumbles something.)

content.speaker: Kathy
content.text: Wasn’t Nick funny when he couldn’t get his match lit?
(Chandler laughs without opening his mouth.)

content.speaker: Kathy
content.text: It’s a good play, isn’t it?
(Chandler mumbles something, and Ross tells him to “Come on.”)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, I loved the play. You were great, and Nick ditto. Clearly you’re having sex with him.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, I… (Walks away.)

content.speaker: Kathy
content.text: Clearly, I’m having sex with him?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh come on, it was so obvious! There was no chemistry between you two!

content.speaker: Kathy
content.text: Okay, so let me just get this straight. You’re accusing me of cheating on you, and insulting my performance?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Y’know, I-I could see how this could happen, y’know you’re up there every night, you’re naked, touching, kissing.

content.speaker: Kathy
content.text: Acting! Chandler, this is my job! I’m-I’m playing a part in a play! How can you not trust me?!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, you can understand, given how we started.

content.speaker: Kathy
content.text: Oh, wow. I can’t believe you’re throwing that in my face.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, that is what happened, and I don’t even see you denying this!

content.speaker: Kathy
content.text: I’ll tell you what, Chandler, why don’t you call me when you grow up!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, well, don’t expect that to happen anytime soon!

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, erm, Chandler and Joey’s, Joey, Phoebe, and Ross are there eating pizza as Rachel enters.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I have the best job in the entire world! The most adorable guy came over today, and I got to dress him up all day!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Rachel has a new doll.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, I wish he was a doll, then I could get a Rachel doll and bump them together and make kissy noises. Oh! And he has the most beautiful name, I never realised it, Joshua! Josh- u -a! Joshua! Josh.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Uh, hello!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi-e!!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ooh, what do I smell?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I don’t know, it smells good.
(He goes over and opens the door to reveal Monica holding a plate of cookies and a fan to blow the smell across the hall.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Fresh cookies! Hot from the oven!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ooh! (They all go over to her apartment)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Please, have some!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, yumm!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah, I’ve just been fiddling around in here making delicious treats for everyone.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Wow! The new Playboy !

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah, it’s just something I picked up.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Cookies and porn, you’re the best mom ever!!
(Rachel laughs hysterically for no reason.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What? What?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, it was just something Josh said about v-necks, but you had to be there.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, how does Jason look in a v-neck?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: It’s Joshua.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, whatever. (Laughs and gives Joey the thumbs up heading back to his apartment. Joey follows him)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Wait! Wait! This isn’t take-out!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, I hate to eat and run, but…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No, wait, please don’t go! I’ve got porn for you too!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, I don’t need it.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: People are supposed to wanna hang out here!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Why? Honey, what is the big deal?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I’m the hostess! Not those guys! I’m always the hostess! I mean, I was always the hostess, I mean even when I was little, I mean the girls brought their dollies to my tea party, I-I served the best air.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, why did you make like a whole big thing out of y’know, everyone has to hang out in the big apartment?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: ‘Cause they took our apartment, I wanted to punish them. But I’m-I’m done now. They’ve suffered enough.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: If you wanted to punish them, you should’ve just made them hang out here!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, that’s true.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: All right then, when I’m done with this place, it’s gonna be ten times better than that place!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, are we gonna trash that place?
(Chandler comes back, obviously drunk, and trips over the steps.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Steps! (He opens the door to his apartment to Ross and Joey looking at the new Playboy ) Slut! (Ross and Joey quickly hide the Playboy behind their backs. Chandler wonders into the girl’s apartment.) You will all be very happy to hear that Kathy is sleeping with that guy!

content.speaker: All
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: So you were right?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I confronted her, and she didn’t deny it! (Pause) I don’t live here! (Goes back into his apartment and they all follow him.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Chandler!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Chandler, what did she say?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Wait a minute.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Come here.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Are you sure?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, I may be drunk, but I know what she said! Then I went over to Beefsteak Julie’s …

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Beefsteak Charlie’s ?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yes! See you and I have always been like—(motions that they think the same.)

content.description: The hallway between the apartments, Monica is lugging one of those floor polishing machines through the hallway. Rachel comes up the steps and stops when she sees Monica.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Whoops. (Starts to go into Chandler and Joey’s.) Oh, hey, do you need help with that?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Nah, I got it.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ooh, I just feel bad, I never vacuum. (She goes into Chandler and Joey’s.)
[Cut to inside the apartment.]

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: All
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: So I was with Joshua for an hour today, and he has not asked me out. It’s just so frustrating!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Why don’t you ask him out?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, yeah, totally! That’s such a turn-on!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Really? It doesn’t seem desperate?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh-ooh, that’s the turn-on.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: He just got a divorce right?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hmm-mmm.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: So he’s probably really nervous around women, y’know? Maybe, you just have to make the first move.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah but, I’ve never asked a guy out before.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You’ve never asked a guy out?!!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No. Have you?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Thousands of times!! That doesn’t make me sound too good does it?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I don’t even know how I would go about it.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh-oh-oh-oh, how I do it is, I look a woman up and down and say, “Hey, how you doin’?”

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, please!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, how you doin’?
(Phoebe looks at him, and then giggles and looks away.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You know what, I’m gonna do that, I’m gonna call him up, and I’m gonna ask him out. I can do that. Ask him out. (Practising) How you doin’? (Calls him) Hi! Joshua? It’s Rachel Green from Bloomingdale’s . (Listens) Yeah, umm, I was wondering if you umm, if you umm, left your wallet at the store today? Well, we found a wallet, and we—(Listens) the license? Well, that is a good idea! Uh, well, let’s see here this says this license belongs to a uh, uh, belongs to a mister uh, Pheebs, and umm, yeah, so sorry to bother you at home. I’ll see you tomorrow. Bye. (Hangs up) (to Phoebe) You’ve done that a thousand times?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I’ve never done that.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ohh, God, I just got so nervous that he would say no.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, you gotta give him something that he can’t say no too. Like uh, Knicks tickets! Invite the guy to a Knicks game, you’re guaranteed he’ll say yes!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Really?! You think that will work?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Absolutely! And if it doesn’t, can I get the extra ticket?
(We hear a noise coming from Monica and Rachel’s apartment.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What the heck is that?
(They go open the door and reveal Monica being spun around on the floor polisher and getting the cord wrapped around her legs.)

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, erm, Chandler and Joey’s, Ross, Joey, and Phoebe are watching a movie as Chandler comes in from his bedroom.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Did she call?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No, sorry.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: All right, maybe I should call her.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No! Forget her, man! You don’t need her, you don’t need that!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: He’s right, what she did was unforgivable.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, yeah, but y’know, what-what if I was wrong?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: How might you be wrong?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well y’know, what if she didn’t actually sleep with the guy?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Dude, tell me she actually told you this.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: She did not have to tell me, I saw the play, and there was no heat. Back me up here, Ross!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: That’s all you’re basing this on?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: That’s not backing me up! Look, you said with the off-stage and the heat, and the onstage and the oy heat.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Whoa-whoa, that-that was just a theory! There’s a lot of theories that didn’t pan out. The lone gunman. Communism. Geometry.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh my God!!

content.description: [Scene: Bloomingdale’s, Rachel’s new job, she is waiting for Joshua and practising how to ask him out.]

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Would you like to go to a basketball game with me? (Tries again.) You know, its funny, basketball, because I happen to have tickets too… (Tries again.) Umm, who likes the Knicks—(Joshua comes in from the dressing room.)

content.speaker: Joshua
content.text: What do you think?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh! Well, as a single woman, who is available, I think you look great!

content.speaker: Joshua
content.text: Huh. (She starts brushing the lint off and checking him out in the mirror.) Yeah?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yep. Oh, yeah, look you great. (She puts her arm in his and checks how they would look as a couple.) Oh yeah. Yeah, this looks great. (Pause) Umm, so you like it?

content.speaker: Joshua
content.text: I do. I do. I love it. In fact, I think I’m gonna wear it home.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Great.

content.speaker: Joshua
content.text: All right, thank you so much for all your help.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Sure.

content.speaker: Joshua
content.text: Well, I guess this is uh, I guess this is it.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah-eah-ha!

content.speaker: Joshua
content.text: Thanks. (He starts to leave) Maybe I’ll see in the spring, with the uh, y’know, for the uh, bathing suits.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh well, you don’t want to do that now?!

content.speaker: Joshua
content.text: Ah, that’s okay, thanks.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Joshua
content.text: Anyway, hopefully, I’ll see you around sometime. (He goes out the door.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Basketball!

content.speaker: Joshua
content.text: I’m sorry.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I uh, I have two tickets to the Knicks game tonight if you’re interested, just as a thank you for this week.

content.speaker: Joshua
content.text: Wow! That would be great.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Really?

content.speaker: Joshua
content.text: Yeah, that would be fantastic! My-my nephew is crazy about the Knicks! This is fantastic, thank you so much Rachel. (He takes the tickets and leaves as Mr. Waltham returns.)

content.speaker: Mr. Waltham
content.text: Good morning.

content.speaker: Joshua
content.text: Hi!
(Mr. Waltham admires Joshua’s butt as he leaves.)

content.description: Kathy’s apartment, Chandler is knocking on the door.

content.speaker: Kathy
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey. I just, I just wanted to come over to-to say that I’m sorry. Y’know? I know I acted like the biggest idiot in the world, and I can completely understand why you were so upset.

content.speaker: Kathy
content.text: Oh wow. I really wish you’d call me.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, I know, I-I wish I had too, but y’know I-I think this is a good thing. Y’know? ‘Cause we’ve had our first fight, and now we can move on. Y’know, I know for me—(Notices a pair of men’s pants on the chair.) Nick’s pants?

content.speaker: Kathy
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah. Well, I think our second fight is going to be a big one!

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, erm, Chandler and Joey’s, Joey is debriefing Rachel on her rejection earlier that day and telling her what she should’ve done. Ross and Phoebe are watching.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay, for next time, what do you say?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I have an extra ticket. An extra ticket. Not, two tickets, I have an extra ticket.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: So the first time you ask a guy out, he-he turns you down?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: He didn’t turn me down! He’s at the game isn’t he? I got the date, I’m just not on it!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay, it’s ready. Come on.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What’s ready?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Just come.
(They all go over to her apartment.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh my God!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Wow! Monica!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Great!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: This is beautiful!
(She has cleaned it, completely redecorated it, removed the carpet, and polished the floor.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh did you—what did you—did you work for two days straight?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Pretty much. (to Joey) So, what do you, what do you think of the floor?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I don’t know, it looks the same.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You used to have carpet.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh yeah!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: So I made snacks. Please, just hang out okay? I’m just gonna rest my eyes just a little bit.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Look, Mon, do you want us to uh, come back later?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh no-no-no, stay, stay, stay, just keep talking. I’m always the hostess.
(Chandler returns.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: How’d it go?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, she wasn’t sleeping with him.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh good!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: She is now.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What are you saying?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I’m saying that she… is a devil woman! Y’know I mean you think you know someone and then they turn around and they sleep with Nick! Nick, with his rock hard pecs, and his giant man-nipples! I hate him, I hate her! Well, I don’t hate her, I love her. This is all my fault really.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: How? How is your fault?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Because, I-I should’ve called! Y’know if I had just called her after our big, stupid fight, she never would’ve gone out with Nick, and they would’ve ended up in bed together. I threw her at his man nipples!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Honey, this is not your fault, just because you guys had a fight, it does not justify her sleeping with someone.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, if-if she thought they were on a break…
(They all turn and glare at him.)

content.description: [Scene: Bloomingdale’s, Rachel is sitting at her desk as Mr. Waltham comes in.]

content.speaker: Mr. Waltham
content.text: Rachel, one of your customers seems to have left his billfold. A Joshua Bergen.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Really?

content.speaker: Mr. Waltham
content.text: Will you call him?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yes! I will! Absolutely! (She takes out his license and her license and holds them face to face with each other. She then proceeds to act like Dark Helmut in Spaceballs , and mimic a conversation between the two of them.) Hello, Rachel. Hi, Joshua. I left my wallet here on purpose. Really? Yes, I just wanted to see you again. Oh, I’m glad. Rachel, I’d like to say something to you. Yes? How you doin’?
